edu.wm.cs.cs301.cullenrombach.falstad

Class MazeBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.wm.cs.cs301.cullenrombach.falstad.MazeBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MazeBuilderEller, MazeBuilderPrim

    public class MazeBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    This class has the responsibility to create a maze of given dimensions (width, height) together with a solution based on a distance matrix. The Maze class depends on it. The MazeBuilder performs its calculations within its own separate thread such that communication between Maze and MazeBuilder operates as follows. Maze calls the build() method and provides width and height. Maze has a call back method newMaze that this class calls to communicate a new maze and a BSP root node and a solution. This code is refactored code from Maze.java by Paul Falstad, www.falstad.com, Copyright (C) 1998, all rights reserved Paul Falstad granted permission to modify and use code for teaching purposes. Refactored by Peter Kemper

    • Method Detail

      • build

        public void build(Maze mz,
                  int w,
                  int h,
                  int roomct,
                  int pc)
        Fill the given maze object with a newly computed maze according to parameter settings
        Parameters:
        mz - maze to be filled
        w - width of requested maze
        h - height of requested maze
        roomct - number of rooms
        pc - number of expected partiters

      • run

        public void run()
        Main method to run construction of a new maze with a MazeBuilder in a thread of its own. This method is called internally by the build method when it sets up and starts a new thread for this object.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • interrupt

        public void interrupt()
        Notify the maze builder thread to stop the creation of a maze and to terminate
